results.title: Manager of Software Engineering
results.description:
NinjaHoldings was founded in 2017 by a team seeking to revolutionize the way everyday Americans interact with financial services. Through our CreditNinja and NinjaCard brands, we empower people overlooked by traditional financial institutions to take control of their finances via a full suite of digital banking and lending products, providing incentives and rewards along the way as we guide them on a path to financial improvement. Through our NinjaEdge brand, we help companies better understand their customers by offering a package of bespoke underwriting, fraud detection, and analytics services. With offices in Chicago, Miami, and around the world through the power of remote work, we are a lean and innovative team always seeking like-minded talent to join us in our fight to disrupt consumer finance.

JOB SUMMARY:

The Manager of Software Engineering will be responsible for growing and leading the CreditNinja development team. The Manager is capable of providing hands-on technical leadership within our software development team. We are seeking somebody who is passionate about the craft of software development, and who uses their incredible people skills to attain peak quality and performance from their engineering team. You actively write code in some capacity, and you're very confident in your technical abilities.

The right candidate understands that a strong relationship with business teams is important. This person also understands that constant incremental improvement can meet long term technical goals while delivering on business needs. The right person has excellent verbal and written communication and is able to articulate complex technical issues with clarity to non-technical teammates.

What You'll Do:

  • Organize, lead and contribute to engineering efforts while demonstrating total ownership of projects, cycles, and programs
  • Drive a results-oriented culture with a strong focus on engineering excellence and execution
  • Contribute to the design and development of existing and new experiences, and foster a team environment that promotes creative thinking, practical problem-solving and a culture that testing is everyone's job
  • Work by and with individual contributors to make informed and thoughtful architectural decisions that ultimately benefit our users
  • Be a steadfast advocate for clean and scalable coding principles and high-performance, secure, easily testable and reliable software services

What We Are Looking For:

  • You have 4+ years of experience as a Developer, plus if it is Ruby on Rails
  • 2+ years' experience as an Engineering Manager
  • You have years of experience leading across the software development lifecycle, including deep knowledge of industry best practices, including but not limited to, pull requests and code reviews, continuous integration and delivery, and post-deployment monitoring and analysis
  • You're a problem solver, and you value passing on your knowledge and methodologies to create a force-multiplier effect
  • You have ample experience advising, coaching, and mentoring peers, direct reports, and less experienced team members
  • Clear written and verbal communication
  • Experience growing an Engineering organization

Additional Pluses, but not requirements:

  • Experience leading teams in growth stage companies
  • Experience in fintech, banking, and lending a big plus

Benefits:

  • Flexible, remote work
  • Fun, fast-paced work environment
  • Dynamic start-up culture
  • Ability to make an immediate impact in a growth stage company
  • Convenient downtown Chicago office located in the heart of the city
  • Equal opportunity employer

results.title: Scada Data Analyst
results.description:
Are you interested in working with the World’s leading AI-powered Quality Engineering Company? Ready to advance your career, team up with global thought leaders across industries and make a difference every day? Join us at Qualitest!

Qualitest is looking for an Data Analyst to join our growing team

Job Description:

  • Possess the necessary level of knowledge and skills of SCADA/EMS-related real-time, historian, and relational databases for SCADA system support and data maintenance with a high-level understanding of complex power systems and design
  • Proven ability in implementing and managing power application software for various Energy Management Systems (EMS/SCADA)
  • In-depth understanding of the various facets of complete Energy Management Systems (EMS/GMS/DMS) framework including the on-site/offsite DR models
  • Resolve complex SCADA and telecommunications problems with the RTUs, ICCP links, and the SCADA/EMS networks and associated equipment in a timely manner
  • Perform engineering duties to improve telecommunications/IP reliability and support the operations of end-to-end communication networks to exchange data with a variety of devices
  • Learn all facets of SCADA system and perform work in an independent manner as well as in a team environment as the job requires
  • Communicate effectively and build strong relationships with team members and customers including leadership and operators, EMS/SCADA vendors, contractors and consultants, Field Operations personnel Substations, Electric System Planning and Substation Engineering on technical and business tasks
  • Apply technical knowledge and experience to identify options, costs and benefits
  • Work on new systems but also support and maintain existing installations. Provide thorough factory and site acceptance testing and documentation
  • Translate requirements into clear, concise documentation for scalable, robust and flexible designs
  • Experience in writing SQL scripts in Oracle/MySQL/SQL
  • Experience with Microsoft Access

Requirements

Need 5+ years of professional experience in the below –

  • Possess the necessary level of knowledge and skills of SCADA/EMS-related real-time, historian, and relational databases for SCADA system support and data maintenance
  • high-level understanding of complex power systems and design
  • Preferred but not required: Knowledge of programming and/or scripting languages (C++, C#.Net, VB.Net, SQL, Python)
  • Preferred but not required: Knowledge of relational database systems, database management, data historians, SQL server with real-time data applications, computer based data processing and networking
  • Strong understanding of power systems including the ability to read Single/Three Line diagrams and complex metering schemes

Benefits

Why Qualitest?

  • Be a part of a company who strives to support for diversity and inclusion in the workplace – we are one, we are many at Qualitest. Celebrate culture, share knowledge with engineers from around the globe, and inspire each other through our differences.
  • Local and global opportunities – we offer you internal rotation and international mobility opportunities to grow your career.
  • Clear view of your career and progression with the company – Qualitest is growing massively (since Jan 2021 – added more than 2000 engineers) and giving you the opportunity to grow with us.
  • Work hard and play harder with our flexible and casual culture. Take a break from work and join an employee event, or enjoy the amenities and games provided from one of our Employees Centers.
  • Save your earnings and prepare for your future by enrolling in our 401k plan where Qualitest will match your contributions accelerating your savings plan.
  • Take care of health with enrollment into one of our competitive healthcare benefits. Qualitest will match towards your HSA if you choose to participate.
  • Never stop experimenting and learning with Qualitest Tech academy: Tuition Reimbursement Program, 3000+ training courses, mentorship programs, technical tribes, sponsored certifications, leadership programs and much more
  • Stay active and get rewarded with our Corporate Wellness Program. We pay your Gym membership and giving you opportunities to Earn additional vacation times for attendance the gym!
  • We invest in our Senior Engineers and leaders with our Equity program
  • Earn bonuses via our Client Referral and Employee Referral Program’s. Refer and earn – tap your network for net-worth.
  • Planning a vacation? Looking for car insurance? Get access to Qualitest Employee Perks for discounts on anything from travel to electronics. With so many offerings the savings are endless!

Intrigued to find more about us?

  • Visit our website at www.qualitestgroup.com
  • Check out our Career page: https://qualitestgroup.com/careers

If you like what you have read, send us your resume and let’s start talking!

results.title: Safer Gambling Analyst
results.description:
We are looking for a Safer Gambling Analyst to join the team! This role provides central support to the Safer Gambling function within the Compliance Team. This role is based on shift work and is remote.

We have internal policies and procedures in place to help prevent the onset of problem gambling which include; self-exclusion, monitoring, affordability assessments, cross-function collaboration and allowing customers to set limits on their accounts.


This role will:
  • Engage with customers who may be at risk or are experiencing harm from gambling and take action where needed, in line with the procedures and policies.
  • Analyse customer accounts flagged by Safer Gambling triggers through internal reporting or interactions that indicate possible vulnerable customers and identify potential addictive behaviour.
  • Monitor customer activity
  • Escalate particular cases where necessary to ensure player protection is safeguarded.
  • Recommend changes or amendments to Safer Gambling processes.
  • Work closely with the Safer Gambling Manager to instil a culture of Safer Gambling through promoting awareness and training.
  • Conduct ad-hoc tasks as directed by the SG Manager and Head of Compliance.

 

This role is part of a multi-disciplinary role and will also follow procedures on AML and Fraud and Risk. Our Safer Gambling commitments include helping reduce the likelihood of problem gambling amongst vulnerable customers and reduce any associated gambling harms our customer base may experience.

Requirements

  • Have excellent oral, written and communication skills
  • Experience with having difficult conversations with customers.
  • Able to work with a number of stakeholders within the business to discuss the customer accounts to reach decisions.
  • Have attention to detail and the ability to quickly review and assess information.
  • Have clear understanding of Safer Gambling in line with the LCCP.
  • Be self-motivated, keen eye for detail, accurate and precise, can work alone or as part of a wider team
  • Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
  • Fluent in English if not a native speaker
  • Be based in the UK
  • Knowledge and experience of the online gambling industry are desirable but not essential as training will be provided.

Benefits

  • A ground-floor role in which you’ll be integral to our company culture and help shape the direction. You’ll be part of a growing community of Midnite employees, partners, investors, and advisors; all focused on our common goal. We love to do things together with regular company-wide meetups, games nights, and team retreats.
  • Comprehensive Health insurance via Vitality so you can stay healthy.
  • 25+ paid holidays and use-what-you-need sick days.
  • Paid maternity, paternity, and adoption leave.
  • A nursery salary sacrifice scheme allows you to pay your children's nursery fees directly from your paycheck.
  • Flexible long-term work options (remote and hybrid).
  • Generous stipends for headphones and your remote work setup.
  • Our team combines years of experience building world-class betting technology with deep esports and sports domain expertise. We are as intentional about building a durable company and inclusive culture as we are about perfecting our product and are serious about flexible work and professional development.

 

About us

Midnite is a next-generation betting platform that is built for today’s fandom. We are a collective of engineers, quants, designers, and marketers who all share a passion for esports, sports, and gaming. We exist to bring fans together and enhance their interactions with their favourite games through the rush of winning money. Whether you want to back your favourite football team or put some money down to win your next game in Call of Duty, Midnite lets you get some skin in the game. Designed and built from the ground up with the newest technologies, we made Midnite for all levels of fandom. Making Midnite intuitive, immersive, and immediately understandable is hard work. But we believe that by keeping this our north star, we can make something truly awesome.

We are backed by some of the world’s top investors that have brought you companies like Draftkings, Betfair, Revolut, Just Eat, and many more. With a central hub in London, we are a remote-first team spread out across the world all working together to shape a new era in wagering. Join us and become part of a passionate group of builders who are obsessed with crafting exceptional products for fans all over the world. We'd love your help.

 

Salary: £22,000

results.title: Data Warehouse Engineer
results.description:
Data Warehouse Engineer
Remote Opportunity

Do you like innovation and technology? We do, too. Reveleer is a healthcare software company serving health plans and care management organizations. Our teams are dedicated to disrupting and modernizing healthcare by building powerful technology that provides an amazing user experience, scalability, and automation.

Reveleer is the first of its kind in our space – a self service platform that mines health data using AI, NLP, and advanced analytics. Our Platform enables health plans to focus on the quality of care people receive, leaving the most complex and repetitive tasks for technology to solve. Be part of what Reveleer is building next!

DUTIES

  • Design, implement and maintain SSIS Packages to handle all ETL needs
  • Design, implement and maintain load, stage, dimension, fact table (OLAP) structures to support the daily running of the data warehouse
  • Maintain the meta data and create relevant documentation
  • Develop approved data models and create data objects for the business users via SSRS, Dashboard tools and/or Excel
  • Monitor job execution times and apply enhancements to improve efficiency to SQL Agent Jobs and using Powershell and ADF (training will be provided on ADF and cloud-based solutions).
  • Develop and maintain TSQL queries to support inserts and updates to the data models

KEY MEASURABLES

  • Maintain and support SSIS Packages…Azure related solutions (Training will be provided), but must have existing SSIS packages and jobs scheduling experience at least 3-5 years)
  • Maintain and support Data Warehouse Architecture
  • Maintain the meta data and documentation process to support the data warehouse
  • Monitor ETL jobs and troubleshoot any issues relating to the ETL jobs

KEY RESPONSIBILITY: Azure Enterprise Data Warehouse Support (Training will be provided on Azure SQL Dedicated Pool)

DUTIES

  • Provide first level technical support on all applications used by the business
  • Granting and denying access to SQL Dedicated Pool
  • Granting and denying access to SQL Dedicated Pool
  • Field incoming help requests from end users (and technicians)
  • Prioritize and schedule problems, escalate problems (when required) to the appropriately experienced technician and/or team leaders as needed
  • Identify and learn appropriate software and hardware used and supported by the business to be able to give technical support when needed
  • Monitor all the ETL jobs to make sure they are running as scheduled
  • Develop technical documentation
  • Any other duties as reasonably required

KEY MEASURABLES

  • All helpdesk tickets are responded to within agreed service level timeframes
  • Successfully provide timely feedback to users on their open helpdesks
  • Successfully provide support and assistance to the users at their level.
  • Successfully troubleshoot problems and provide level 1 support
  • Prioritize helpdesks and project work and communicate with users to inform them of priority changes.

Essential: Qualifications

  • Tertiary qualification in Information Technology, Software Development/Engineering, or Computer Science and/or other relevant disciplines Essential (BA/BS degree required):

Essential: Other

  • Microsoft Office Suite: Intermediate
  • Experience extracting data from SQL Databases, comma delimited files and other databases · Intermediate Microsoft Excel and pivot controls experience
  • Experience with relational database concepts and structures
  • Experience with writing and understanding TSQL language Required (Expert Level)
  • Proficient in ETL development and maintenance with SSIS · Working knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server administration and query plans, etc.
  • Knowledge of best practices/methodologies in Data Warehousing

Desirable:

  • Some Experience/Understanding with C# and or VB, web services and XML development
  • Some Experience/Understanding designing, creating and maintaining SSRS, SSIS, SSAS, Excel pivots and dashboards.
  • Understanding the levels of the development life cycle (Required)
  • Data Analysis experience
  • Ability to facilitate meetings with users to identify data visualization design prototypes
  • Some familiarity with Power BI or SSRS (desired but not required)
  • Excellent customer service skills

What You'll Receive:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Medical, Dental and Vision benefits
  • 401k
  • Generous PTO Plan

Reveleer is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis or race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or genetic information, in compliance with applicable federal, state and local law.

results.title: Recruiter/HR Specialist
results.description:
About Us:

Located in Seattle, Washington in the United States, CG Tech Services (cgtechservices.com) is a Managed Service Provider (MSP), focused on providing best in class IT support and cybersecurity services for businesses and not-for-profits of 5-1,000 employees.

Job Description:
We are seeking a skilled human resources specialist who is passionate about recruiting, and supporting and developing talent through our company's policies and procedures. Our ideal candidate will be responsible and reliable, experienced in recruiting work, screening, interviewing, and assessing candidates. They should be highly efficient, organized, and approachable. We expect applicants to have a solid knowledge of various HR functions and administrative responsibilities. Under limited supervision, the HR Recruiter Specialist provides support in functional areas of Human Resources which include recruitment, onboarding, personnel records, regulatory reporting requirements, benefits administration and other areas as needed. This is a fully remote position that would be working with existing and recruiting new team members in the United States, South Africa, the Philippines, and other countries.

This would be a good fit for someone who:

• Is humble, motivated, and emotionally intelligent, specifically with a high degree of empathy.

• Enjoys helping others succeed and sees their role as maximizing the output of their team.

• Loves a faster-paced, no-drama environment where office politics, backstabbing, gossip, and negativity are not tolerated.

• Is extremely detail-oriented and appreciates people who take an organized, systematic approach to achieving success.

• Likes the idea of working for a smaller but growing company where their ideas and contributions directly impact the company’s success, direction, and growth.

• Is a quick, self-motivated learner who wants to work for a company that will invest in their education.

• Wants a position that will offer upward earning and career advancement; we want people who are interested in growth, learning, and becoming part of our team long-term.

Hours:
This is a full-time position of 40 hours a week. The expectation is that the majority of your hours worked would be Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM Pacific Time to collaborate with our team. However, hours will have some flexibility to conduct interviews with job candidates in various time zones.

Responsibilities:

• Collaborates with department managers to identify and draft detailed and accurate job descriptions and hiring criteria.

• Identifies and implements efficient and effective recruiting methods and strategies based on the available role, industry standards, and the needs of the organization.

• Manage job posting and advertisement processes.

• Attends and participates in online job fairs and recruiting events.

• Maintain organizational charts and detailed job descriptions along with salary records

• Screens applications and selects qualified candidates.

• Prepare and distribute assessments and numerical, language, and logical reasoning test.

• Schedules interviews, oversees preparation of interview questions, and other hiring and selection materials.

• Update employee records with new hire information and/or changes in employment status.

• Implement training and development plans as part of new team member onboarding.

• Performs employee onboarding to include data entry into the HR Information system and new employee orientation. Ensures data entered is complete and accurate and provides guidance to employees ensuring they have a thorough understanding of company policies and procedures.

• Assists in creating and updating the employee handbook.

• Ensures compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and company policies.

• Performs other duties as assigned.

Requirements

Skills & Qualifications:

• Excellent spoken and written English communication skills.

• Successful work experience as a Human Resources Specialist, officer, recruiter, administrator, or other HR position

• Strong working knowledge of HR functions and procedures (e.g., pay and benefits, recruitment, training, and development)

• Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, using Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS), and LinkedIn Recruiter

• In-depth knowledge of or willingness to learn hiring strategies, labor laws, and employment diversity, equity, and inclusivity.

• Commitment to staying current on the understanding of labor laws and disciplinary procedures.

• Proficient with or the ability to quickly learn applicant-tracking software or other recruitment systems.

• Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

• Ability to create and implement sourcing strategies for recruitment for a variety of roles.

• Proactive and independent with the ability to take initiative.

• Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.

• Familiarity with laws, regulations, and best practices applicable to hiring and recruitment.

• Aptitude for critical thinking, problem-solving, and decision making.

• Strength of character, ethics, commitment, reliability, and integrity.

Education & Experience:
Minimum of three (3) years of related work experience in HR, or a higher education degree and one (1) year of related work experience in Human Resources.

Physical Requirements:
Prolonged periods of sitting/standing at a desk and working on a computer, including VoIP phone calls and video meetings.

Other Requirements:• You will need to provide your own computer that is running Windows 10/11.

• Allow us to install software on your computer that keeps it up to date with security patches and anti-virus because we work with heavily regulated industries in the United States. Security precautions are paramount for us.

• Have a headset that connects to your computer to use our VoIP phone system to communicate with our team and job candidates.

• Have Internet access of at least 20 Mbps download and 10 Mbps upload speeds to work with our systems.

Benefits

Professional Development:

This position has the opportunity to grow into an HR Manager, Director of HR, or Chief Human Resources Office.

 

Cultural Fit Considerations:
As this job posting is to an international audience with differing beliefs and cultural norms, please be aware that we are a progressive company with LGBTQIA+ team members and clients. While we respect and honor many forms of diversity, equity, and inclusivity, LGBTQIA+ people in the United States and other countries do not have equal protection nor treatment. This statement is not meant to exclude recognizing and celebrating other forms of diversity important to our team, but to be explicit in informing you of an important aspect of our team and clients.

 

Equal Employment Opportunity PolicyWe prohibit discrimination with respect to the hiring or promotion of individuals, conditions of employment, disciplinary and discharge practices, or any other aspect of employment on the basis of sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, veteran status, or any other basis of discrimination prohibited by applicable local, state, or United State of America federal law.

results.title: Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist / Recruiter with Polish
results.description:
Who are we?

With its European headquarter located in Prague, Prodensa is a global company supporting clients’ international operations. We are a part of an international consulting group, that delivers a 360-degree service, starting from market intelligence, through tax & legal compliance, HR & recruitment services, business advisory, digital marketing support and interim agile teams & experts to launching ready-made companies and organizations. With over 35 years of experience, presence in 140 countries and 800+ >1MLN USD projects already delivered, we are one of the most trusted partners in this business area.

We are selective not only of the Candidates, but also of our Clients – and we do care about both.

This is also why our recruitment division is one of the top – focusing mostly on areas in demand, like IT tech & SW development, digital, data & e-commerce, medical & pharmaceutical, banking & finance, sales and customer support or R&D and manufacturing in aerospace, automotive, construction and other industries.

We are looking for an experienced recruiter with Polish for our internal projects as well as for one of our renowned clients:

A leading materials science and manufacturing expert headquartered in the USA, operating in 21 countries with a global team of 25,000 employees.

Location: Poland - remote

Possible cooperation forms: permanent employment / freelance contract full-time or part-time

Do you want to be a part of a well-resourced company that has a modern business approach and uses state-of-the-art recruitment technologies? Are you a fan of holocratic company structure where you can realise your full potential and try yourself in various roles and industries? Then this offer is the right fit for you!

Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist will be responsible for identifying and screening candidates and building partnerships with line managers to conduct talent acquisition activities. The ideal candidate must have a proven track record in creatively sourcing and hiring talents for the automotive sector.

Your role will entail:

  • Responsibility for the entire recruitment process ensuring proper candidate management and maintenance of the applicant tracking system,
  • Providing information and guidance around the recruitment process, sharing market insights, proposing recruitment strategy and providing regular feedback and following up on the process,
  • Proposing, implementing, and maintaining recruitment KPIs,
  • Performing web research and leveraging Social Media channels as relevant in accordance with sourcing strategy,
  • Responsibility for the development and execution of internal and external sourcing strategies,
  • Planning and evaluating sourcing methods used to recruit quality candidates, with an emphasis on identifying new sources,
  • Identifying and developing branding initiatives and establishing relationships with relevant institutions that could be candidate sources (schools, universities, associations, etc.),
  • Implementation of Talent Acquisition processes and acting as an ambassador of recruitment culture,
  • Cooperation with HR and hiring managers to present and establish a new recruitment model and processes
  • Ensure a high level of candidate experience.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in human resources management or similar area of study
  • A minimum 3-4 years of experience in full life cycle recruitment
  • Experience in recruitment processes for automotive and global business services sectors
  • Knowledge of the labor market and experience in leveraging different sourcing techniques (e.g. LinkedIn, social media, direct search)
  • Effective screening and interviewing skills
  • Innovative mindset, to identify and establish recruitment operational efficiency
  • Fluent English and Polish - a must
  • Advanced proficiency in MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
  • Ability to work, interact and consult with Hiring Managers from different levels of the organization and from different European countries
  • Attention to detail and ability to drive accountability
  • Organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks and set priorities in a fast-paced environment
  • Negotiation skills
  • Ability to work independently

Benefits

We offer:

  • To join a stable global company
  • To gain experience and grow your expertise in a variety of areas and industries
  • To dive deep into the world of modern technology-related branches
  • To enjoy lots of flexibility related to: working hours, type of contract, diversity of projects and location as with 100% home office you can literally work from any place in the world as soon as there is internet connection ;)

results.title: (Junior) HR Manager (all genders)
results.description:
About us:

We are a digital services company undergoing change. Today, Cocomore successfully provides digital services to clients like Nestlé, Procter & Gamble, Rabobank, Samsung or Sanofi. We are developing our services activity into co-entrepreneurship with our clients. This is driven by our activity as company builders which we have pursued in parallel to the services business: We successfully built a number of digital start-ups on our own account, so far sold to Deutsche Telekom, Axel Springer and Pro7Sat1.

We are looking for an HR Manager to support our great HR team. The job can also be done remotely. 

Cocomore currently is a team of 200, mostly located in and around Berlin, Cologne, Frankfurt, Hamburg, Seville and Warsaw.

Your Job:

  • Deliver first-class employee support, formalizing the on- and offboarding process, creating and managing employment contracts and maintaining employee data within our HR Information System (Personio), administering absences, payroll and further developing local benefits
  • Ensure that all local legislation and regulations are in place across Germany, Poland, Spain and Switzerland
  • Implement clear, efficient processes when driving change, collaborating with the management and the HR team
  • Be a driver for positive employee engagement through the rollout of new initiatives and leading on projects that further enhance the employee experience

Your skills & experience:

  • You have gained 2-4 year of work experience in an HR function, in particular in HR Operations and Administration, ideally in an international environment
  • You are well versed in labor law and have knowledge of social security law and tax law
  • Excel is your playground and you already have experience in creating HR reports (HR Controlling)
  • You are excelling in strong and professional communication in German and English (both verbal and written) and you have an ability to exchange information with others clearly and concisely
  • You are a very structured person and your positive attitude makes you stand out
  • You are proactive and don't need to be told what to do; you identify problems and take care of them straight away
  • You know Datev, MS Office well, especially Excel and Word

What you can expect from Cocomore:

  • Work where you want: in one of our super-modern offices, remote or both
  • Expect a competitive salary and good perspectives to be actively promoted
  • Employer-paid benefits such as training budgets, and various internal initiatives, like knowledge-sharing sessions or team-building events
  • Enjoy employee discounts at partner companies 
  • Enjoy Team spirit and start-up atmosphere while working in a well-run organization

What will happen next?

  • You will receive an email confirming that we received your documents
  • Afterwards our recruitment team will inform you if your experience matches our requirements
  • If yes, you will be invited to the online interviews

results.title: Sales Leader
results.description:
Our client is hiring for a sales leader in the Saas space with an interest in the home renovation/disaster/restoration space. They've had a long established company in the industry and have developed an exciting Sass solution to serve their clients as well as competitors in the space. This individual will need to be a highly efficient team builder and leader, with experience growing teams from scratch. They currently have 1 SDR in place and are looking to scale. You will effectively be responsible for the GTM strategy for sales, hiring, training and development of a high performing sales team and structure out the department with your previous experience and skills. If this sounds like a challenge you're interested in, apply today!

Role Overview:
- Work with CEO in to develop Sales Strategy
- Implementation of 3x y/y growth plan with current product
- Recruit and manage sales talent
- Manage current sales process (1 SDR)
- Work with Marketing for streamlined process to/from Sales
- Implementation of HubSpot instance for Sales
- (Possible) Identify tangent markets and/or tangent offerings leveraging their capabilities


Compensation and benefits are to be negotiated directly with the CEO (equity, salary, bonus, benefit are all on the table.)

  • 5+ years in Saas Sales leadership (selling, training, hiring and developing highly effective teams)
  • Saas Sales experience
  • Disaster/Restoration experience preferred but not required
  • Experience with GTM sales and marketing strategies and processes
  • successfully scaled revenue from $0-20M+
